identity.name: E1
identity.mission: Create a 'Clinical Serenity' aesthetic that balances medical rigor with human warmth. Avoid generic SaaS templates.

fonts.usage: Body text, UI elements, Buttons, Navigation (The 'Modern Clinical' Voice)

rules.labels: font-dm-sans text-xs font-bold tracking-wider uppercase text-muted-foreground/80

primary.usage: Main Brand Color, Headings, Primary Buttons (Navy Blue)

secondary.usage: Backgrounds, Secondary Buttons, Card Hover States (Soft Blue-Grey)

accent.usage: Active States, Links, Highlights (Calm Sky Blue - sparingly used)

landing_page.description: Two distinct vertical panels for 'Wellness' vs 'Clinical'. Hovering one expands it (60%) and compresses the other (40%).

course_catalog.description: Mix of 1x1 course cards and 2x1 feature highlights.

dashboard.description: Fixed sidebar, scrollable content area. High density data display for enrolled courses.

Button.default: rounded-sm font-dm-sans font-medium tracking-wide transition-all duration-300

Card.base: rounded-lg border border-slate-100 bg-white shadow-card hover:shadow-hover transition-all duration-500 ease-out group

Input.base: rounded-sm border-slate-200 bg-slate-50 focus:bg-white focus:border-primary transition-colors h-12 font-dm-sans

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. THEME SETUP: Update `tailwind.config.js` and `index.css` FIRST with the HSL values provided in `colors`. This is critical for the Navy/Blue theme.
2. FONT SETUP: Import Google Fonts (Playfair Display and DM Sans) in `index.css` or `index.html`. Do NOT use default system fonts.
3. LANDING PAGE: Build the 'Split Pathway' interaction. Users must choose 'Wellness' or 'Clinical' to proceed. This is the core UX.
4. COMPONENTS: Use existing Shadcn components but apply the 'Visual Enhancers' classes. Don't leave them default.
5. DATA-TESTID: Add `data-testid` to all buttons, inputs, and cards.
6. IMAGES: Use the provided image URLs. Do NOT use placeholders unless specified.
7. MOTION: Use `framer-motion` for the split screen effect and page transitions.
universal_guidelines: Avoid generic 'SaaS Blue' gradients. Use solid, deep Navy (#0F172A) and clean White.
Use 2x more padding than you think is necessary. 'Clinical Serenity' requires breathing room.
Never center text in cards. Left align for readability.
Ensure 'Coming Soon' badges are visually distinct (e.g., subtle grey background with lock icon).
